metadata.title: CVE-2019-19630 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
HTMLDOC 1.9.7 allows a stack-based buffer overflow in the hd_strlcpy()function in string.c (when called from render_contents in ps-pdf.cxx) via acrafted HTML document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19630` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

htmldoc - 1.8.27-8ubuntu1+esm1
htmldoc-common - 1.8.27-8ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: htmldoc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.27-8ubuntu1+esm1').
